frameDefinitions: A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules.
A particular Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect.
The words in this frame describe Manners of verbal communication.
A Dependent state-of-affairs has a Requirement as a prerequisite for obtaining or occurring.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a  Responsible_party.
frameExamples: Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
<t>Illegal</t> drug use is on the rise.
This law will only become in <t>effect</t> during the last three weeks of the year.
The atomic bombings were probably not <t>necessary</t> to win WWII without a mainland invasion of Japan.
It would <t>behoove</t> us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The <fen>Action</fen> is the behavior which complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen>.
The <fen>Object</fen> complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen> by virtue of its existence, location or possession.
The <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is the law, contract, principle, or other (set of) obligations that is (or is not) operational.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is in effect.
The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not operational.
Speaker is the sentient entity that produces a Message or communicates about a Topic. It is expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
Addressee is the person to whom the Speaker  is communicating.  When expressed, the Addressee occurs as a PP Complement:
Message is the content which is communicated by the Speaker. The Message may be a direct quote, a finite complement clause or an NP Object:

Topic is the subject matter of the communicated Message.  It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>about</ment> and, in this frame, is frequently preceded by a quantificational noun which is treated as referring to the Message:
The time at which the communication event takes place.
The location at which the communication event takes place.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the <fen>Dependent</fen> to obtain.
An entity that has to be present for the <fen>Dependent</fen> state of affairs to obtain.
The time at which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary for the <fen>Dependent</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> denotes a location in which the specified relation between <fen>Requirement</fen> and <fen>Dependent</fen> holds.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is mandatory.
A location in which the <fen>Duty</fen>  obtains.
listRoleExamples: There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
Illegal <fex>drug use</fex> is on the rise.
Once <fex>the treaty</fex> is in effect, US port authorities and the Coast Guard will monitor compliance by checking any yacht 79 feet or longer.
All patent applicants and owners should be aware of the current uncertainty as to what patent fees will be in effect <fex>on October 1, 1998</fex>
This promotion is void <fex>in the state of Florida</fex>.
The taxi driver chattered away <fex>to me</fex> about gardening.
<fex>'I- It was an accident,'</fex> Jo stammered.
The actor chattered <fex>about the difficulties of being famous</fex>.
<fex>In the US</fex>, the political clout of big city mayors is necessary to put this on the national agenda.
<fex>Getting a shot against yellow fever</fex> is obligatory for travellers to Benin.
The use of TM software is obligatory <fex>for every freelance translator working on projects for our company</fex>.
<fex>These days</fex>, wearing a seat-belt is mandatory.
Gymnasium is not obligatory <fex>in Sweden</fex>, but nearly everyone attends gymnasium

- Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act
